@BBCAmos @UnlikelyWorlds Looks like the kind of place that's going to end up being nuked from orbit.
"Brexit plan." You keep saying those words. I do not think it means what you think it means
@DavidDavisMP Why do you think you have a mandate to leave the Single Market when Leave specifically said otherwise in their campaign?
@AltCaStateParks Seeing the picture before reading the tweet, I was expecting a medical explanation.
@j0000e @annaturley That seems to be exactly how I see it. I think you have the wrong end of the stick. I was referring to Herr Farage
@wesstreeting I don't agree with how you voted, but I understand why you did. Keep hammering on about no mandate to leave the single market.
@annaturley I think an enemy of democracy is someone who gets elected and then refuses to do the job they were elected to do

@mjohnharrison Upton Snodsbury, Tibberton & Crowle Wyre Piddle, North Piddle Piddle-in-the-hole
My family lived in 3 of these villages

@torykene @Channel4News Only racists like you.
@ded6ajd I can see that, while convoluted, it does simplify the operations!
@PATSTONE55 I'm afraid that would put them at a disadvantage. To be fair, my 8yr old is excellent at maths & reading, so methods are working
@PATSTONE55 @MichaelRosenYes I can see years of education frustration ahead of me.
@ded6ajd @MichaelRosenYes showing my age here (must admit the way my sons are taught maths baffles me), but what is non-trad long division
@MichaelRosenYes He can read "chair" & "fair", but is it fair for him (age 6) to know that "tair" is alien, and not the spelling of "tear"
@MichaelRosenYes I am fuming that my son is having to learn "alien" words. Do they teach meaningless equations in maths now?
